hints.content: Start by understanding what a 'special character' is in this context. A character is special if it appears in both lowercase and uppercase forms in the string. For example, 'a' and 'A' together make 'a' a special character.
Consider how you might track the occurrences of each character in both lowercase and uppercase. You could use two sets or dictionaries to keep track of the characters you've seen in each case.
Remember that the input string can contain a mix of uppercase and lowercase letters. Think about how to iterate through the string and check each character's case.

As you iterate through the string, you might want to convert each character to a common case (either lower or upper) to simplify your checks. This could help you determine if both versions of the character exist in the string.
Consider using a data structure that allows you to efficiently check for the existence of both cases of each character. A set might be a good choice for this purpose.
Think about how to count the number of unique special characters. Once you identify a character as special, make sure you only count it once, even if it appears multiple times in different cases.
Pay attention to edge cases, such as strings that contain only one case or strings that are very short. For example, a string like 'A' or 'a' should return 0 since there are no special characters.
You can use a loop to go through each character in the string and populate your sets for lowercase and uppercase characters. After populating, you can compare the two sets to find common characters.
To find the special characters, you can take the intersection of the two sets (one for lowercase and one for uppercase). The size of this intersection will give you the count of special characters.
Finally, make sure to return the count of special characters as the output. Remember to test your solution with various inputs to ensure it handles all edge cases correctly.

questionNotes: The string consists only of lowercase and uppercase English letters.
A letter is special if it appears in both lowercase and uppercase forms.
